ZoneText: MU postpones Sem V exams; may be held after Diwali

Mumbai: Mumbai University’s semester V exams for final-year students will be postponed and are likely to be scheduled after Diwali. While a circular to this effect is yet to be released, it will be done after the board of examinations’ meeting.
On Wednesday, senate members affiliated to Yuva Sena gheraoed the acting director (board of examinations and evaluations), Prasad Karande, in his office and sought postponement of exams. Students from several colleges also gathered near Exam Bhavan to appeal to the university authorities.
Students from at least five city colleges wrote to MU seeking exam postponement as they claimed that they did not get adequate time and practice for a written test in the long-form pattern. They said they have given only online exams with multiplechoice questions for two years. An official said Karande has given assurance to the students and students’ organisation. A meeting will be held and a decision taken within four days, he said. TNN
